title: National Purple Heart Day, 2025
summary: The document is a presidential proclamation declaring August 7, 2025, as National Purple Heart Day. It honors military personnel wounded or killed in action, highlighting the history and significance of the Purple Heart medal, which was established by George Washington in 1782. The proclamation emphasizes the sacrifices of recipients and their families, and commits to a foreign policy of peace through strength. The President also expresses gratitude for their devotion and sacrifice, and proclaims the day to honor their heroism and legacy.
